content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" is the short title of this legislation, which includes definitions for various terms. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" includes definitions for terms such as 'LGBT' and 'older LGBT individual' in an amendment to the Older Americans Act of 1965. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration, headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary to coordinate activities for improved services for older individuals. The Director is responsible for coordinating activities within the Department of Health and Human Services and advocating for older LGBT individuals at the federal level. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration to advocate for older LGBT individuals at the federal and state levels, support research, and enhance service delivery. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to support research, collect data on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, and promote service delivery for this population. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to gather statistics, collect information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, recommend policies, and promote culturally competent care for this population. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to recommend policies and priorities for older LGBT individuals living with HIV/AIDS, administer grants, and submit reports to Congress every five years. Additionally, a Rural Outreach Grant Program is added to the Older Americans Act of 1965. The term 'Director' refers to the Director of the Office of Older LGBT Policy, while 'eligible entity' is defined as an entity that applies to the Director and focuses on serving the needs of older or LGBT individuals. This includes states, agencies, organizations, institutions, and area agencies on aging. The purpose of this section is to provide eligible entities with resources and incentives to devise long-term plans. Eligible entities include states, agencies, organizations, institutions, area agencies on aging, and multipurpose senior centers, focusing on serving the needs of older or LGBT individuals in rural areas. The term 'rural area' refers to an area not classified as urban by the Census Bureau. The purpose is to help eligible entities create strategies for reaching older LGBT individuals in rural areas. The Director can provide grants for approved activities. The Director can provide grants to eligible entities for connecting with older LGBT individuals in rural areas through approved activities. Eligible entities must submit an application containing required information. An eligible entity must submit an application to the Director for a grant under this section, including a description of proposed activities and the population in a rural area served by those activities. An application for a grant under this section must include a description of proposed activities, the population in a rural area served, resources expected to be available, and intent to partner with local organizations. Approved activities for the grant aim to create a lasting partnership between older LGBT individuals in rural areas. The grant under this section is available for activities approved by the Director to create a partnership between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and the eligible entity. Approved activities may include education and training for community outreach to older LGBT individuals in rural areas. Approved activities under the grant may involve education, training, and community outreach to older LGBT individuals in rural areas to reduce isolation and improve access to care. Additionally, fostering relationships between local LGBT-affirming service providers and older LGBT individuals is encouraged. Approved activities under the grant aim to reduce isolation and improve access to care for older LGBT individuals in rural areas by building relationships with the local community, fostering relationships with LGBT-affirming service providers, improving cultural competency, and expanding non-discrimination policies. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant to improve LGBT cultural competency and expand non-discrimination policies for older individuals in rural areas. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant to protect sexual orientation and gender identity, create inclusive community spaces for older LGBT individuals, and allow for local adaptations. Coordination with local entities will also be emphasized. Standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant under this section allow eligible entities to adapt them for individual projects based on local circumstances. Coordination with relevant State and local agencies is required for entities receiving a grant under this section. Adaptation is necessary due to local circumstances. Eligible entities must cooperate and coordinate with State and local agencies, as well as public and private organizations, when carrying out approved activities supported by a grant.
